page.title: 01Carrick Coastal Hill Land
page.content: There is no present habitation in this block the bigger half of the area being claimed by the sea. The trunk road (A77) between Glasgow & Portpatrick hugs the shore and a notable feature is Kennedy's Pass named after an old Ayrshire family of that name. Landward the ground rises steeply to the high point of Pinbain Hill (736 ft) and is all rough hill pasture grazed by cattle and sheep. Drainage is by some half dozen burns to the sea. An interesting feature of the area is an old coach road which linked Girvan and Lendalfoot. Access to the northern end is gained about 400 yards north of Kennedy's Pass. The track winds upwards passing the ruined steading of Kilranny and eventually levels off at some 4/500ft above sea level giving magnificent views of the coast, Ailsa Craig & the
